titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Paul Garris et al., Transcript
CWG10910

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Nelson Cir. Court. Sept. Term 1861.
Commth. of Ky. Plff.
against } Larceny,,
Paul Garris. Defd

Defendant not appearing though called. It is ordered that the Bail Bond be and the same is hereby declared forfeited, and that process issue thereon, and on further motion of Plantiff ordered that a Bench Warrant issue against the Defendant endorsed that he be admitted to Bail in the sum of $600 for his appearance.

Nelson Cir. Court, March Term 1862
Commth. of Ky. Plff.
against } Forfeiture of Bail Bonds.
Paul Garris, Jos Henin. &c Defd.

The Process herein having been duly executed and the Defend. not appearing, It is ordered and adjudged by the Court, that the Plaintiff recover of the Defendant Jos. Henin, the Sum of Four Hundred Dollars, the amount of the Bail Bond forfeited herein, and the Costs hereof and may have Execution &c

Nelson Cir. Court, Sep. Term 1861.
Commth. of Ky. Plff
against } Enticing negroe
Paul Garris. Defd

Defendant not appearing though Called. It is ordered that the Bail Bond be and the same is hereby declared forfeited, and the Process issue thereon, and on further motion of Plaintiff it is ordered that an Alias Bench warrant
issue endorsed, that he be admitted to give Bail in the Sum of Three Hundred Dollars for his appearance.

Nelson Cir. Court, March Term 1862
Commth. of Ky. Plff.
against } Forfeiture Bail Bond
Paul Garris, Jos Henin. &c Defd.

The process herein having been duly served on the Defd. Jos. Henin, and he not appearing, It is ordered and adjudged by the Court, that the Plaintiff recover of the Defendant Jos. Henin the Sum of Five Hundred Dollars, the amount of the Bail Bond forfeited, and the costs herein expended and may have Execution &c

The foregonig, are true Copies.
Att:
Wm Murphy C. N. Cir Co

Comth of Ky.
v. } Record
Paul Garris &c
